alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 1245 PM EDT... At 1215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles west of Warren, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Corry, Columbus, Spring Creek, Lottsville, Sugar Grove and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
